author: M Rajeev
text:
The Andhra Pradesh government has reiterated its resolve to provide reservation to Kapu/Balija/Ontari/Telaga communities without hurting the interests of the backward classes.

Justice Manjunatha Commission, appointed to look into the issue, is expected to submit its report within eight months. The government created a Kapu Corporation to provide income generating activities for poor families among these communities and Rs. 1,000 crore would be spent for this purpose during the next financial year, Governor E.S.L. Narasimhan said in his address to the joint session of the legislature on Saturday.

Andhra Pradesh had recommended to the Centre that Rajakas be included in the Scheduled Caste and Valmikis in the Scheduled Tribe list as these communities enjoyed similar status in certain other States. The interest of the weaver community was also of paramount importance to the government and Rs. 110.96 crore had been spent towards weavers’ loan waiver.
title: A.P. reiterates commitment to Kapu reservation
